events.title: Birth of John F. Kennedy
events.description: John Fitzgerald Kennedy born in Brookline, Massachusetts, the second of nine children in the prominent Kennedy family.

events.title: Near-Fatal Illness
events.description: At age three, JFK nearly dies of scarlet fever, beginning a lifetime of health challenges.

events.title: Enters Harvard University
events.description: Kennedy begins his studies at Harvard University, following in his older brother Joe's footsteps.

events.title: Graduates from Harvard
events.description: Kennedy graduates cum laude from Harvard University with a Bachelor of Arts in government.

events.title: Joins U.S. Naval Reserve
events.description: Kennedy joins the U.S. Naval Reserve as World War II intensifies.

events.title: PT-109 Incident
events.description: Kennedy's PT boat is rammed and sunk by a Japanese destroyer. He saves his crew, earning the Navy and Marine Corps Medal for heroism.

events.title: Health Issues and Discharge
events.description: Kennedy suffers from chronic back pain and other health problems related to his PT-109 injuries. Honorably discharged from active duty in early 1945.

events.title: Elected to U.S. House of Representatives
events.description: Kennedy elected to represent Massachusetts' 11th congressional district at age 29.

events.title: Elected to U.S. Senate
events.description: Kennedy defeats incumbent Republican Henry Cabot Lodge Jr. to become U.S. Senator from Massachusetts.

events.title: Marries Jacqueline Bouvier
events.description: John F. Kennedy marries Jacqueline Lee Bouvier in Newport, Rhode Island. The wedding is one of the social events of the year.

events.title: Back Surgery and Recovery
events.description: Kennedy undergoes dangerous spinal surgery and nearly dies during recovery. During convalescence, he writes 'Profiles in Courage'.

events.title: 'Profiles in Courage' Published
events.description: Kennedy's book about eight U.S. Senators who defied popular opinion is published. It wins the Pulitzer Prize in 1957.

events.title: Daughter Caroline Born
events.description: Caroline Bouvier Kennedy, the first child of John and Jacqueline Kennedy, is born.

events.title: Re-elected to Senate
events.description: Kennedy wins re-election to the U.S. Senate by a landslide margin, positioning him for a presidential run.

events.title: Announces Presidential Campaign
events.description: Kennedy announces his candidacy for President of the United States.

events.title: Democratic Nomination
events.description: Kennedy wins the Democratic nomination for president at the Democratic National Convention in Los Angeles.

events.title: First Televised Presidential Debate
events.description: Kennedy debates Richard Nixon in the first-ever televised presidential debate. His poised appearance gives him a critical advantage.

events.title: Wins Presidential Election
events.description: Kennedy defeats Richard Nixon by a narrow margin to become the 35th President of the United States, the youngest person ever elected president at age 43.

events.title: Son John Jr. Born
events.description: John Fitzgerald Kennedy Jr. is born, shortly after the presidential election.

events.title: Inauguration as 35th President
events.description: Kennedy is inaugurated as President. His inaugural address includes the famous line: 'Ask not what your country can do for youâ€”ask what you can do for your country.'

events.title: Establishes Peace Corps
events.description: Kennedy signs an executive order establishing the Peace Corps, a volunteer program providing international development assistance.

events.title: Bay of Pigs Invasion
events.description: CIA-trained Cuban exiles attempt to invade Cuba at the Bay of Pigs. The operation is a complete failure, with all invaders killed or captured.

events.title: Moon Landing Goal Announced
events.description: Kennedy announces the goal of landing a man on the Moon before the end of the decade, launching the Apollo program.

events.title: Berlin Wall Erected
events.description: East Germany begins construction of the Berlin Wall. Kennedy responds by reinforcing U.S. commitment to West Berlin.

events.title: John Glenn Orbits Earth
events.description: Astronaut John Glenn becomes the first American to orbit the Earth aboard Friendship 7, a major milestone in the Space Race.

events.title: Cuban Missile Crisis
events.description: U.S. spy planes discover Soviet nuclear missile bases in Cuba. The 13-day standoff brings the world to the brink of nuclear war. Crisis resolved when Soviets agree to remove missiles.

events.title: 'Ich bin ein Berliner' Speech
events.description: Kennedy delivers his famous speech in West Berlin, declaring solidarity with the people of Berlin: 'Ich bin ein Berliner' (I am a Berliner).

events.title: Limited Nuclear Test Ban Treaty
events.description: Kennedy signs the Limited Nuclear Test Ban Treaty with the Soviet Union and United Kingdom, prohibiting nuclear weapons tests in the atmosphere, outer space, and underwater.

events.title: Son Patrick Dies
events.description: Patrick Bouvier Kennedy, born prematurely two days earlier, dies of infant respiratory distress syndrome. This tragedy deeply affects the Kennedy family.

events.title: Assassination in Dallas
events.description: President Kennedy is assassinated in Dallas, Texas, while riding in a motorcade. He is struck by rifle bullets and dies at Parkland Hospital. Lee Harvey Oswald is arrested for the murder.

events.title: Oswald Killed
events.description: Lee Harvey Oswald, accused assassin of President Kennedy, is shot and killed by nightclub owner Jack Ruby while in police custody.

events.title: State Funeral
events.description: President Kennedy's state funeral is held in Washington, D.C. Leaders from 92 nations attend. He is buried at Arlington National Cemetery.
